<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 193, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 215, 356, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 193, 907, 208]]<|/det|>
9709/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 216, 907, 232]]<|/det|>
May/June 2012  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 239, 907, 254]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 320, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 367, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 325, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 433]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 284, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 495]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 590, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 540, 606, 556]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 572, 440, 588]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 603, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(|x^{3} - 14| = 13\), showing all your working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 120, 97, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 128, 703, 285]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 303, 920, 355]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(y = A(b^{x})\), where \(A\) and \(b\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(x\) is a straight line passing through the points (0, 2.14) and (5, 4.49), as shown in the diagram. Find the values of \(A\) and \(b\), correct to 1 decimal place.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 336, 918, 354]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 380, 96, 399]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 380, 395, 400]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[379, 406, 618, 427]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = a x^{3} - 3 x^{2} - 5 x + a + 4,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 434, 293, 453]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 465, 154, 483]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 465, 606, 484]]<|/det|>
Given that \((x - 2)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\), find the value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 465, 920, 484]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 495, 343, 514]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label> When \(a\) has this value,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 521, 185, 540]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[201, 521, 406, 540]]<|/det|>
factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 521, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 545, 603, 565]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label> find the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x + 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 545, 920, 564]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 592, 96, 611]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 592, 603, 611]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label> Given that \(35 + \sec^{2}\theta = 12 \tan \theta\), find the value of \(\tan \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 592, 920, 611]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 623, 153, 642]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 623, 845, 642]]<|/det|>
Hence, showing the use of an appropriate formula in each case, find the exact value of

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 648, 176, 667]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 648, 301, 667]]<|/det|>
\(\tan (\theta - 45^{\circ})\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 648, 920, 667]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 675, 178, 693]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 675, 255, 693]]<|/det|>
\(\tan 2\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 675, 920, 693]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 81, 707, 266]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 282, 705, 305]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = 4\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{x}} - 6x + 3\) and its minimum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 317, 153, 336]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 316, 920, 351]]<|/det|>
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\) can be written in the form \(\ln a\), where the value of \(a\) is to be stated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 333, 920, 351]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 363, 151, 381]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 362, 920, 396]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of the area of the region enclosed by the curve and the lines \(x = 0\), \(x = 2\) and \(y = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 381, 920, 400]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 425, 96, 444]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 425, 390, 444]]<|/det|>
A curve has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[379, 452, 616, 486]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{1}{(2t + 1)^2}, \quad y = \sqrt{(t + 2)}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 491, 887, 512]]<|/det|>
The point \(P\) on the curve has parameter \(p\) and it is given that the gradient of the curve at \(P\) is \(-1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 526, 153, 545]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 526, 376, 546]]<|/det|>
Show that \(p = (p + 2)^{\frac{1}{6}} - \frac{1}{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 526, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 558, 151, 576]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 556, 920, 592]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative process based on the equation in part **(i)** to find the value of \(p\) correct to 3 decimal places. Use a starting value of 0.7 and show the result of each iteration to 5 decimal places. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 619, 97, 638]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 619, 161, 638]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[163, 618, 764, 641]]<|/det|>
Show that \((2\sin x + \cos x)^2\) can be written in the form \(\frac{5}{2} + 2\sin 2x - \frac{3}{2}\cos 2x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 619, 920, 638]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 658, 153, 680]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 653, 584, 692]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi} (2\sin x + \cos x)^2 \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 662, 920, 681]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
